newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU confirms British Gas/Group 4 meter reading deal.
newsitem.headline: EU confirms British Gas/Group 4 meter reading deal.

text.p: The European Commission said on Tuesday it had cleared the creation of a joint venture between British Gas Trading Plc and Group 4 Utility Services Ltd to supply meter reading services in Britain.
It said in a statement that the venture called AccRead would initially be the only supplier of such service which was formerly carried out by British Gas staff.
But it is confident "competition will emerge as other utility suppliers commence similar activities", the statement said.
The joint venture follows the privatisation of British Gas and anticipates the separation in 1997 of its transportation, and storage activities and its trading services, the statement said.

The Commission also noted that it was the intention of the British authorities that a competitive market for meter-reading services should be created in the gas industry as well as for other privatised utilities.
Group 4 Utility Services Ltd is a subsidiary of Group 4 Securitas NV, a supplier of security services based in the Dutch Antilles.
